content.body: But deep importing is discouraged by the npm ecosystem by "export map", you have to explicitly expose the folder you want to (when using export map)
it certainly means your "exports" needs to enumerate all your entry points, sure
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: it certainly means your "exports" needs to enumerate all your entry points, sure

content.body: but it means users have much smaller bundle sizes and/or memory footprints, way smaller than "treeshaking" can achieve
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: but it means users have much smaller bundle sizes and/or memory footprints, way smaller than "treeshaking" can achieve

content.body: It would be fair to say that export maps tilt the field slightly away from accidental deep exports in a way that gives package authors an important degree of control over the expression of their forward compatibility commitments, but I would not say it discourages deep exports.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: It would be fair to say that export maps tilt the field slightly away from accidental deep exports in a way that gives package authors an important degree of control over the expression of their forward compatibility commitments, but I would not say it discourages deep exports.

content.body: you have to explicitly add a `.` also, and explicitly make your barrel/manifest file, so it seems the same to me as far as maintainer effort
